website_summaries.verdict: If you are new to Nylabone or want a variety of long-lasting chew toys, this is the one to pick – you get 3 for an unbeatable price.
pros: A 3-pack that offers a variety of textures and flavors with Nylabone's sturdy yet safe construction that withstands serious chewing
Consumers rave about how long they last and how their dogs are attracted to the flavors
cons: Textured bone's "nubs" may not be appealing to dogs that aren't powerful chewers

customer_reviews.title: You should  know...
customer_reviews.text: Nylabones caused both my small dogs to have slab fractures of their teeth, back molars. We discovered this a few years after they started chewing them, and they both had to have teeth extracted (they didn't chew anything else that was hard). Our veterinarian said they are too hard for some dogs. We bought the small ones for aggressive chewers... we bought them regularly because they chewed a lot. I threw all of them out after the 1st discovery, never again. It's a shame, they really liked them. I was told these are the best, not true. Buyer beware. I don't know what is a good option now, I won't use rawhide either.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Every dog has her day!!!..
customer_reviews.text: It has been a long time since my chewy dog had a chewy toy bone so I ordered these for her. She was very excited when I put them all in front of her to choose from. She went for the red one. I also learned my lesson about real bones because recently I gave them a cooked bone that was substantial (not chicken) and one of them almost died from bone fragments. No more of that because I can't afford to buy meat anymore after that vet bill. I have 3 dogs and only one is interested in the Nylabone. For her it is the best birthday ever.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Over 6 months still around
customer_reviews.text: I still step on these chew toys. They don’t use it everyday but they still chew on them now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: My teething pup loves them
customer_reviews.text: My puppy has been teething for months, and she used to chew on the legs of chairs. I bought these for her just to see if they’d work, and they do! They definitely get a little worn in overtime, but there are 3, so after one loses the chewing part, I just give her a new one. They last a long time (about 1-2 months each), which is great considering she is a heavy chewer. She is small though (~8 pounds), so maybe if your dog is bigger, he or she might get through the toy faster. Either way, I think these are great.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: This is our dogs SECOND favorite nylabone pack!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the price and quality of Nylabones, and our dogs LOVE LOVE LOVE THEM. Their favorite nylabones are the textured ones, so of course the bacon one is a favorite out of this pack. Peanut butter is a definite seconds, and of course the chicken is the tried and true regular flavor they get often. I wish they were all textured-- I also purchase the Summer BBQ flavor frenzy pack because my guys REALLY love the corn on the cob flavor!!! It is their FIRST FAVORITE NYLABONE pack
customer_reviews.author: Beaglegirl

customer_reviews.title: My dogs don't like these
customer_reviews.text: My dogs aren't excited about these bones at all. They'll chew on them if they absolutely can't find any other bones, but they really don't seem to like the flavors. I thought my teething puppy would like the blue one with the bumps, but that one seems to be every dogs least favorite. The only one I've seen any of them chewing on since opening them is the white one. Pretty disappointed in this pack of bones
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs won't touch them
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 dogs: Chihuahua, Poodle, Pug, and Terrier. I bought the variety pack ... not one of the dogs will have anything to do with these bones. Can't say as I blame them, the bones are like chunks of plastic. What a waste of money for us. Update: gave them to the neighbors and their dogs could not even be bothered to check them out.
customer_reviews.author: InPinkClover

customer_reviews.title: For Powerful Chewers.
customer_reviews.text: I am owned by three dachshunds. They are very powerful chewers and destroy most toys in under 10 minutes. We found these bones when one was a puppy because she chewed everything in sight, and it needed to stop. I was introduced to the blue nubby bone for puppies and I put the others away until she was a bit older. These bones are beyond durable! Each of my dosgs has his/her own set of bones (they don't share well). I would be lost without these bones! They can occupy he dogs for hours of chewing pleasure!
customer_reviews.author: Doxie Mommie

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 pound Torkie (fox wire-haired terrier/Yorkshire terrier) is a power chewer. I purchased these specifically because they were for power chewers and had good reviews. Eva had a lot of small slivers of the bone that she was ingesting. These were not durable at all and she should not have been able to be eating parts of the bone. We switched to natural antlers and will never purchase any Nylabone products again.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Priceless
customer_reviews.text: Priceless. Sometimes my dogs ignore these for a while, but when they do need to chew, they’re always happy to chew on a nylabone. I’m happy with the low price so that I’m not disappointed when they are lost for months in the grass or under the couch or stolen by a friend’s dog. I give this size to four dogs ranging from 50-90lbs and they chew it slowly over time, no problem. These bones are not digestible, but the dog should only ever be able to slowly break off the teeniest pieces which pass through their system no problem. It’s hard as a rock, but take it away if your dog somehow is able to really consume it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Scott

customer_reviews.title: Almost killed my dog.
customer_reviews.text: This item cost me over $500 in vet bills when the nylon bits tore up her intestines and gave her a serious case of gastritis. She had to have IV fluids and medication and continuous x-rays to check the bits' progress throughout her system. After seeing the x-rays, the vet techs stopped giving them to their dogs. We tell everyone we know not to use Nylabone. I will be contacting the company with copies of her x-rays and vet bills.
customer_reviews.author: Anya Wales

customer_reviews.title: Every dog should have one
customer_reviews.text: Bought the medium size because Daniel can chew through a small nylabone pretty quickly. The medium is fine and keeps him busy for a while and gives him something to chew on instead of things he’s not supposed to touch. Works well. He takes his chewing urges out on the nylabone. He loves all the different flavors. Honestly, I thing they all love something to chew on no matter what they are or their taste. The nylabone also help clean his teeth, which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpion E

customer_reviews.title: What smell/taste??
customer_reviews.text: My 16 lb terrier, who will chew/eat ANYTHING with some flavor, dutifully and excitedly smelled each of these, twice, and walked away, giving me "the look" as if I'd betrayed him somehow. He couldn't have been less interested. Can't understand why some dogs love them (according to reviews) and some are completely disinterested -- ?
customer_reviews.author: BARBARA VANNESS

customer_reviews.title: We truly like these, as the first set of chew toys ...
customer_reviews.text: Added 2 new puppies to our already stuffed household of 2 older dogs and 3 cats. In DESPERATE need of something for these needle sharp toothed chewing machines to gnaw on, we bought 2 packages for them... one set of 3 is kept int their *living room* (laundry room), while the 2nd set of 3 stays in their *play room*, the living room. We truly like these, as the first set of chew toys we bought them, they completed destroyed a rubber star within a single day! Although they chew and chew on these bones, they're not making a dent in them!
customer_reviews.author: Boudica

customer_reviews.title: She particularly liked the bacon flavored bone with the textured nubs
customer_reviews.text: I kept seeing Nylabones all over the place so thought I'd give them a try. Our dog isn't a BIG chewer, but she likes to have something to do and keep her entertained. She particularly liked the bacon flavored bone with the textured nubs. However, after one session of chewing on them, the scratched surface hardened and became way too sharp to give to her without trimming them. After trimming the bone I was worried about her swallowing pieces, so we haven't continued to use these any more.
customer_reviews.author: SMcLeod

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a teething black lab puppy. He was never interested in them. He will give them a cursory nibble when I put one in his mouth if he's chewing on something he's not supposed to - but otherwise they just sit there in the pile of $100's of dollars worth of the other chew toys I've bought him. Some he will use, some he turns his nose up at. These totally fall into the "turning his nose up to" category.
customer_reviews.author: QueenEvil

customer_reviews.title: bones for a puppy
customer_reviews.text: we have various bones for our new puppy. She loves a really soft one but chews pieces off. she doesn't love these as much and there are few chew marks on them. not sure how to make them more enticing for her. thought the flavored ones would help. maybe too hard for her little teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Bec

customer_reviews.title: Great for daschunds
customer_reviews.text: The ones for power chewers are a hard material. While my daschunds like the more rubbery texture of the moderate chewer ones, these ones have definitely lasted 100% longer! Most toys only last a few days with them! Once they start getting some "teeth marks " in them, they play with them more. These will definitely last!
customer_reviews.author: S. Leveille

customer_reviews.title: THESE BONES ARE OKAY
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8 year old silver lab and two 11 week old silver lab puppies. The puppies will chew on the bones a little bit and the 8 year old will chew on it, only if the puppies want it. None of the three of them are really interested in the bones, unless they think that they are keeping it from one of the other two.
customer_reviews.author: Terron

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny...great for chewers!!
customer_reviews.text: I've searched forever for a treat my mini schnauzer could have. She's a chewer and most toys that say durable she runs through in 15 minutes tops! I decided to spend more to get one that last. This brand really holds up!!! She been chewing on them for months and isn't even close to finishing. I'd say it will take her at least 8 months. I can even leave them in her kennel while I'm away. She loves the chocolate flavored the best!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: No smell or flavor
customer_reviews.text: There is no smell whatsoever to either of the three bones. My kid taste tested an unused one straight from the box and said they taste like nothing. My dog isn’t interested in them and my mother in laws dogs would go near them. They’re also really hard plastic so just be aware of what to expect.
customer_reviews.author: Anya

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not the puppies favorite
customer_reviews.text: It was just bleh for our puppy. They seem plastic like. Super hard and our puppy licked them a few times but hardly showed any interest in them. The blue one had some grooves I feel like he seemed more interested in. But other than that, probably won’t repurchase. They just sit in his basket unused.
customer_reviews.author: V Kay

customer_reviews.title: Nice for casual chewers and to give bored dogs something to do
customer_reviews.text: I got these as some general chew toys for my pups. Growing up we used these all the time for teething puppies. One of my dogs really likes these and will occasionally chew on them which was all I wanted. My other dog is obsessed with food and while these are flavored I don't think they are scented, or at least strongly scented, so she was not very impressed with them and I haven't seen her use them. I would not recommend them for powerful chewers or dogs who try to swallow things.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Honestly the best chew toy for dogs
customer_reviews.text: These Nylabones are a life saver! They last a long time and don't cause a choking hazard like some other toys. When my dog was a puppy, he found interest in chewing on furniture, but then when I gave him the Nylabones, he had something way better to chew on which prevented any damage to my home. Highly recommend, Bentley loves the Cherry Slushee flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike but everything to like about this product. They last forever and are great for dogs that like to chew. I only buy the ones that last for months. They do sell ones that only last a couple days but I don't buy those. There are a lot to choose from so read in detail before you buy to make sure what you want. My dogs love these and as a pet owner of dogs that like to chew, I love them too. My dogs only chew the nylobone and not my vacuum cords anymore. Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lindig

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in getting two bones unflavored I guess I should have read it more closely thought it was a variety However my dog loves the chocolate one Great for chewing and seems to be holding up I have a 35 lb cocker spaniel and it’s doing it’s job keeping him busy
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Yum Yum...love them (from DOG) and her Mommy says...NO dental cleanings needed with these
customer_reviews.text: This review was furnished by my dog. She said..arf arf..yum yum...order them anytime Mommy. Mommy (me) says these work great for keeping her teeth clean. She is 8 and we have never needed to have her teeth cleaned..Nylabone does the trick. She has about 12-15 around the house and she likes different ones at different times..big, small, in between, as long as they are durachews or for power chewers.
customer_reviews.author: jackolyn

customer_reviews.title: Harder than expected...but my fault.
customer_reviews.text: These are the hardest! I must be blind. Took me forever to see the red arrow on the bottom package signifying the chew strength. In my defense, I am colorblind (mostly red/green). My barely 5lb. 12 wk old Shih Tzu puppy doesn’t mind chewing on it, moreso if I hold it. I’ve ordered the medium level. He probably wonders why it doesn’t taste like a dental chew.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I like Nylabone for its durability and it’s a brand I trust. I have a 1 1/2 year old Pomeranian/Papillon that loves to chew just about anything. I have nicknamed her the beaver because of this. The Nylabones are safe for pets and lasts a long time. I recommend buying this brand of dog bones-you’ll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the very worst item I have ever bought for my dogs they are nothing but hard plastic and does absolutely nothing for them they won't even touch them this product is horrible dogs like something they can ingest not break their teeth on it.
customer_reviews.author: Doris Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for toy breeds
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they are smaller and I thought would be good for smaller dogs as a result. Unfortunately, they are very hard and not suitable for the teeth on my little guys. I gave them to a family's members bigger dog. It's a good product, just not recommended for the smaller fur kids.
customer_reviews.author: Ileana K

customer_reviews.title: Nylabones are great! But pay attention to what size you're getting.
customer_reviews.text: So I'm an idiot and thought these were large, the price was definitely too good to be true. But before I could return them my dogs found them and chewed them. So, 5 stars because Nylabone is great and my pups love them, even if they are tiny and make me concerned that they're a choking hazard to my bigger dogs. Oh, and side note, there are Nylabones remnants all over my couch and bed. But it's worth it I suppose!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Dogs won't chew these.
customer_reviews.text: Bummed none of our 3 dogs like these. They are a waste of money. get the dark green one that looks like a Y. Our pups love that one. I'd love a coupon or something since these are just getting donated to my shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Awful Product
customer_reviews.text: My 16 lb rat terrier was biting off and eating slivers of the bone within 5 min. Not sure what they claim this product is made out of but has the appearance and feel of just straight plastic. To claim this is for extreme chewers is incredible. I had one nylabone product in the past that lasted quite a while but probably won't be trying anymore of theirs after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Our miniature schnauzer loves these! When she gets too excited she will often find one of her Nylabones and "stress chew". When she was a puppy we would put a little peanut butter on the end of a Nylabone to help with crate training. As with any dog toy, make sure you watch your dog carefully to make sure this product is right for them...we have never had an issue with this version of Nylabones, but our dog can break off big pieces of the softer versions.
customer_reviews.author: Lin09

customer_reviews.title: My dogs favorite bones
customer_reviews.text: My two corgi's are aggressive chewers and they love their nylabones. I decided to get a different three pack than normal. I've bought the blue bones with the texture before and they were softer and bendy. The blue bone in this pack is made from the same material as the other harder bones which is great. My dogs love to try to chew the little nubs off the blue bone and since it's a harder material it takes a lot of work. My dogs can't get enough of the bones. I don't think the flavor matters they them they love them all equally.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly RTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20lb Shih Tzu and he loves these bones. He has a little collection and these are inexpensive enough that I can swap them out when he chews them too ragged. If he's happy, I'm happy. And with these, he is very Happy!
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: They love them.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these bones. They have lasted a really long time and they haven't even gotten half way through them. My dogs are heavy chewers but these are definitely holding up. Only complaint is that the little pieces they do get off are very sharp and get stuck in fabric.
customer_reviews.author: James Brock

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love nylabone! These are the only bones we buy--great quality. These dura chews are the best for strong chewers! They keep my dog occupied and he doesn't wear them down too quickly. These bones are suppose to clean their teeth. The small fragments that chip off while chewing can safely pass through the gut. The only downside is that they get kind of sharp after a while. (Just try to not step on them and you'll be fine!) Love this brand and all dura chews!
customer_reviews.author: tobey nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great for strong little chewers!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints here. We love Nylabone products in our house. We have a small dog with jaws of steel, so chew toys that last longer than one day are hard to come by. Nylabone keeps him occupied and doesn't wear down easily, so he can chew to his heart's content! Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: For the chewer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when they were on sale through the flash deals and I'm glad I did. I was a little hesitant at first because one of the bones is chocolate flavored but the packaging assured that it wasn't actual chocolate and is safe for dogs! I have two rather large dogs and one of them can really chew. Usually we have to buy her Kong toys because she'll chew through everything else. Well they've had these for about a month now and they are still in great condition so I recommend these for dogs that really like to chew because these bones can handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality! My 10 month american bully destroyed all of the bones in less than an hour. The residual of the material are sharp hard plastic... really dangerous if my dog eat it. Never allow my dog to play without supervision with this toys because doesn’t seem secure. Only lasted an hour, and had to take them off for their safety
customer_reviews.author: Josuha

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Quite durable. I always seem to purchase these for my dogs, however i do wish they were more favorable so they would be my dog's go to choice for teething! I generally have to really encourage my dogs to gnaw on them.
customer_reviews.author: ShenValley

customer_reviews.title: My pup’s favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I have a large breed pup and teething has been unbearable. These bones have been perfect. She seems to be drawn to their flavor and chooses them over other toys/bones we have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amber McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Nylabone Durachew
customer_reviews.text: Love these for my power chewers! My 3 power chewers love these bones and they last about a month. All other bones get demolished within 48 hours. I have a Shar-Pei, a Coonhound, and a Brittainy Spaniel/Doberman/Border Collie Mix. These three dogs can chew through anything. The regular size is right for all of them, not too large and not so small that they cause a choking hazard. My little Bedlington Terrier likes these too. One of these would last him an eternity as he has a very soft bite. My dogs seem to like the chocolate (brown) flavored one the best of the three. I highly recommend these and they are much safer than rawhide.
customer_reviews.author: LyndaA

customer_reviews.title: Not good for strong jaws/chewy pups
customer_reviews.text: These bones would be good for dogs who don't chew too hard on them, but for my dog (a pitbull) she chewed them to bits in an hour. I went to the bathroom while she was chewing, came back and her mouth was bleeding from the pieces. She was fine (would have continued to chew anyway) but these bones were destroyed very quickly and easily by my dog and they were not good for her mouth. If your dog likes to destroys his toys or is a bigger dog, I would not recommend. On the bright side, she did love the taste of them!
customer_reviews.author: Elena Swarr

customer_reviews.title: ok.
customer_reviews.text: My puppy likes them but I can see where his teeth have scratched up and indented the surface and worry that his health could be affected by him ingesting lots of tiny bits of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Susanna T.

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Durable for legit hard chewers. Some complaints were ridiculous IMO. If the gums bleed its probably strengthening them like flossing with humans. If it hurts when you step on it look where you are walking! Dog loves them
customer_reviews.author: bennylog

customer_reviews.title: Good toy
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these, they fight over it more than actual food. The only thing is after they chew a lot it starts getting really pointy and they start chewing off the lil pieces of plastic which i find a lil scary, they actually scratch me w it sometimes. So take it away and throw out when this starts to happen as the instructions say
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra C.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Your Pup Playing!
customer_reviews.text: The red ones are my dog’s favorite. These hold up a lot better than some of the other ones, and I don’t worry about my dog chewing on something too aggressive.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great for all size dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love them. I got a variety of sizes for all of my dogs but they all love these. From my 12 lb poodle to my 50 lb pitbull all 4 of my dogs love them. They have also lasted very well. Nylabones are the most durable toy I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Not edible
customer_reviews.text: Bacon flavored throughout but not edible. Call your vet if your dog ingests any of it. This makes no since to me. Returned the item because there was no chance of my aggressive chewer not ingesting any of it.
customer_reviews.author: MONICA

customer_reviews.title: Dark brown is chocolate flavored!
customer_reviews.text: Only gave 3 stars because the dark one is chocolate flavor. Why make chocolate flavored chew toys for dogs when chocolate is so highly toxic to them?! It will only encourage them to become interested in chocolate. Nylabones themselves are tough enjoyable chew toys for dogs. Throwing away the chocolate flavored one, though.
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: Good chewy toy
customer_reviews.text: My older dogs don’t care for them much but my pit puppy loves them. She collects them and puts them in a pile in front of her.
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: Great distraction for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: My medium sized Golden Retriever LOVED these bones. I gave them to her as a Christmas present and she loves them so much! She will chew on one for a while, and then she will grab another and keep them close to her. This is a good pack of bones for dogs who are aggressive chewers, and keeps a busy dog occupied for a good amount of time!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Dog wont touch them
customer_reviews.text: The product is as advertised but unfortunately my dog wont have anything to do with these. I have tried giving him all three flavors and he wont even lick them!!! Not sure what the deal is but as far as my puppy goes, these get two paws down. : (
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them, good price
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them. Only problem is he destroys them as soon as we give it to him. Being that he is an aggressive chewer, they don't last very long, but the product is not advertised as indestructible or for aggressive chewers. The price is better than other sites, especially pet supply sites. I have to replace them often, but it keeps my dog busy, help cleans his teeth and fills his need to chew. And he's so happy and excited when I give it to him.
customer_reviews.author: AMB

customer_reviews.title: Keep an eye out
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a heavy chewer. He made quick work of these and after only 10 or 15 minutes have them looking like a piece of steel wool. Normally this wouldn't concern me however they're made out of a very tough material and they started cutting his gums. I don't necessarily believe this to be a bad product as I love Nylabone. However I would recommend keeping an eye on your pet as they chew these and making sure to remove them if they get to this stage.
customer_reviews.author: Tek Hudson

customer_reviews.title: My dog will not have anything to do with Nylabones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 5 different types of Nylabones, hoping my dog would like them and stop chewing my furniture, etc.; but he had absolutely no interest in them at all. Completely ignored all of them no matter what I did.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what it says it is. Appears to be a genuine nylabone product. I bought these to have as a backup chew toy since my dogs go through the softer chews very aggressively. This is hard plastic with almost no give to it. So whether your dog likes it may depend on their preference. The scent/flavor is not strong. So it’s non offensive for humans but may not be that enticing.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, stood up to my Doberman, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love these toys. They have kept my Doberman entertained for months. He's a heavy chewer and these hold up. I am a religious Nylabone buyer. They're nontoxic and you don't have to panic if pieces are swallowed. They come out in the exact form they went in and are easy to pass. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Pagliaro-Katz

customer_reviews.title: good for teething
customer_reviews.text: Good for teething but my dog eats it for few seconds and leaves it. especially the white one... he likes the red one..
customer_reviews.author: PCD

customer_reviews.title: None of the dogs I've offered these to want them.
customer_reviews.text: My dog was interested in these for about 3 minutes then never touched them again. Can't really blame her....who wants to chew on plastic? Weird product. I'm surprised this company is as big as it is since not one of the 4 different dogs I've tried to give these to (after my dog rejected them) has shown any interest.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis A

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: These must be for humans, dog has no use for it at all. A knotted old sock gets more play than these things. Have a puppy who loves to chew on anything but not these.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty Blacksmith

customer_reviews.title: Boston terrier approved
customer_reviews.text: We love these and get them for our boston terrier, which I will call an "enthusiastic" chewer. He can destroy nearly any toy in mere minutes, these take him several months to work on. I was afraid they would have that weird fake meat/dead road kill smell, but they do not. I was also worried they would be sticky or slimy, nope same texture as the unflavored variety. Other than him making it into a shiv, for us to find and step on at 3am, it's a eat toy. We have bought several over the years and I see many more in our future.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs_Weeble

customer_reviews.title: Buy Two Packages
customer_reviews.text: if you have 2 pups. Both choice peanut butter as their favorite, so that's a tiny problem. I quickly bought another package & I'm teaching them to share nicely. Suburb for hours of relaxing chews. Very durable, does not flake or fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for teething puppies or just to chew for older dogs. My mini Australian Shepherd has chewed these these since a puppy and it has saved many furniture legs.
customer_reviews.author: LadybugFarm97

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: 3 styles included. All our dogs love these. Can even survive a Rottys bite.. Fast shipping, easy seller.
customer_reviews.author: luvprettybling

customer_reviews.title: Life savers for husky puppy owners
customer_reviews.text: My puppy husky loves to chew on them but I did try smelling them and actually bite into one. I didn’t taste anything. One less star because there’s no actual flavor unless only dogs can taste it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy/Jenny

customer_reviews.title: One hit wonder
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy got super thirsty after chewing on these. He also lost interest after 20 minutes of licking all the flavor off and hasn't touched them since. We won't be buying anything from this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Good long lasting chew/toy
customer_reviews.text: My dogs (one small Whippet mix and one larger Chocolate Lab/Pointer mix) enjoy these, although they'd much rather have a rawhide chew or bone. If I keep them away and only give it to them on occasion then they get very excited about them. If I leave them lying around they barely touch them. So keep them up and give them to your dogs when they're bored :) Also, they've been lasting a very long time. I've also let my sister's Pit Bull have a go at them and they seem like they would last a good, long while with her as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nick & Angela

customer_reviews.title: my dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My chewy cocker spaniel loves these – she seems to almost pick a flavor of the month, so it's nice that there are three different flavors because she seems to get excited about each one as she rediscovers each one on a rotating basis. Great size for her mouth, too.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good bones
customer_reviews.text: These are the only bones my dogs chew. Only complaint is they get mangled easy then we have to take them away-but they last quite a while before we have to do that
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Dogs aren’t going for these
customer_reviews.text: The dogs are not liking these. They go for other brands but are not going for these for some reason. The Nila bones are usually a great tool for avid chewers. Wish they would go for these.
customer_reviews.author: koernda

customer_reviews.title: Dogs didn't like
customer_reviews.text: Dogs didnt like them so they kinda just sit there. Once in a great while i will see one get chewed on by my kids play with them more than the dogs. Not the point!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Nylabone
customer_reviews.text: This item would be good with a larger mouth They were too large for my dogs mouth. She will not use.
customer_reviews.author: Roamer

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for less aggressive chewers.
customer_reviews.text: They hold together well but my extreme chewer got pieces of them stuck in her teeth. Made her gums bleed. Will not buy again for her but may be suitable for less aggressive chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Wiley

customer_reviews.title: works but sharp shreds
customer_reviews.text: what I love is that my 45 lb power chewer loves these and leaves everything else alone. what I don't love is it becomes a rough surface very quickly and sometimes her mouth bleeds and the hard bits get stepped on with bare feet. but she keeps chewing and I keep buying
customer_reviews.author: dogsinfl

customer_reviews.title: Zoey loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Our baby, an 18 lb rescue MUTT, loves them and carries one with her everywhere she goes. She just turned 18 months old but still loves to chew on them as she's falling asleep. We keep a few in our nightstands for those nights she takes longer to settle down for bed. Saves my shoes! Zoey approves this message 😉
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable &dogs love them.
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended this type of bone. We have a 1 yr old rottweiler. She has made some progress, but it will take forever, if she thinks she's going to chewcit down.
customer_reviews.author: dmcj611

customer_reviews.title: No scent or flavor -  dog not interested at all
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Dog sniffed it and walked away. I couldn't detect any kind of scent on these either. If they had flavor there would be some scent. They're just a piece of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: My dog has no interest in these
customer_reviews.text: Meh. They are durable. My dog hasn’t chewed through them, but she also seems disinterested. The flavor aspect has no attraction for her. She seems to prefer a slightly softer plastic bone, which makes me wonder about the flavor strength.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy L. Webster

customer_reviews.title: LOve the product, but dogs would not use them,
customer_reviews.text: still recommend this product and the company, sorry they did not work for me, i recommend the product
customer_reviews.author: Webby

customer_reviews.title: Best Bones Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love these for my dogs. Nylabones are the best and safest bones for your dogs. My dogs can't break off large pieces of Nylabones like they do rawhide, so they don't choke on them.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny B.

customer_reviews.title: Their favorites
customer_reviews.text: These ones are my dogs favorites. I have to buy two packs because they just steal from each other. “You have the blue one? I wanted the blue one!” “You have the red one?? I wanted the red one!” These three are the best, apparently
customer_reviews.author: Not your average unicorn

customer_reviews.title: Best Toy for the heavy duty chewers!!
customer_reviews.text: Most "extremely durable" chew toys don't last more than a few hours in my home. These bones lasted for months with my 2 doodles.
customer_reviews.author: gr8shopper

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these bones. This is the third or fourth set we've had to purchase, because she will shred the plastic with her sharp little teeth. I don't mind getting new bones because at least she's not gnawing on the furniture! They are affordable enough to replace when they get worn out and they do last several months - it's not like I have to buy a new set a week. This is the first time I've gotten the set with the chocolate bone, which she really seems to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lady

customer_reviews.title: Dogs keep throwing up pieces.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love nylabones. Even though the chew through them they've never had an issue. These seem strange they are more like plastic and my dogs were eating them and throwing up the pieces of plastic. I wouldn't buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chew toy for my boys.
customer_reviews.text: Nylabones are the only chews I have found that are durable enough for my dogs. Most other toys are torn up in a day or so. These last months. My dogs are 30-35 pounds and I think the size is perfect for them. They seem to favor the blue textured bone most. I like the fun colors and flavors too, something a little different from the original/chocolate combination that I usually buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nbtokb

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog, happy life!
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves these. I have bought these numerous times and Amazon is the way to go. You can spend 4-5$ more at a pet shoppe! I tried another version of these and received the wrong size and everything so I am sticking to this one now. My dog loves the spiky ones.
customer_reviews.author: tara

customer_reviews.title: Great chewing toys
customer_reviews.text: These are really hard and I didn't think the dogs would like them. I was wrong. They love them! Even though I got 3 of them (packages). They still fight to have the same one!
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: The dogs love them, but they're not as tough as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my schnoodles destroy every toy you put in front of them. I was hoping that they would be indestructible, but they can be chewed into small pieces, so supervision is still needed. The dogs love them, though.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: good for chewers
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love these. We have two dogs that chew and tear apart their toys. The Nyla Bones are the best thing we have found to satisfy their chewing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for buzzsaw living under our roof
customer_reviews.text: The blind dumb one can have these last for months, and it's not because she can't see where she left them. These are seriously tough. Everything else (rings, kong balls, couch cushions, carpet, other small animals, etc.) succumbs to her razor sharp teeth in minutes. In her prior life, she was a piranha. We'd muzzle her, but we'd lose fingers, and not because she's mean, she just really likes to chew things. These last, and last, and last.
customer_reviews.author: BearTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: What a waste!
customer_reviews.text: My dog will eat/chew just about everything she can sink her teeth into EXCEPT THIS!!! She wanted nothing to do with these bones. I tried giving her all the bones at once thinking it was maybe the flavor she didn’t like and no, she was not having it. She refuses to put these in her mouth! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I give four stars because my dogs love teething on them
customer_reviews.text: I give four stars because my dogs love teething on them. This is a really good price compared to the price at petsmart or petco. But these aren't very sturdy. They only last maybe a week or less for my dogs who are 13 and 15lbs. If you have a heavy chewer, this may not be the best product out there.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping your pup busy
customer_reviews.text: Both my pups love these! They’re strong chewers and they’ve lasted two weeks in.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Green

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't like
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is the product or my dog, but he does not long them and never uses them.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph E.

customer_reviews.title: Good value, and the dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: I'm not so sure about the wisdom of giving your dog a taste for chocolate, but it was nice to find these available on Amazon. Also, there was no edible bone in here, just three dura-chews. Every time I've found nylabones in the pet stores, they've sold two dura-chews and an edible bone. If I want an edible, I'll just buy an edible, so I don't need a variety pack. The dog loves these things -- they satisfy her anxiety-chewing impulses, and it takes her weeks to get through one.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Joe Joe Jr. Shabadoo

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: don't waste your money . This is a terrible product and most dogs hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Debedeb

product_meta.title: Nylabone Power Chew Variety Triple Pack
product_meta.description: Size:Small/Regular - Up to 25 lbs.| Style:Chicken, Bacon & Peanut Butter FlavorTriple the flavor, triple the chewing! Made with tough, durable nylon, these Power Chew DuraChew chew toys are the long-lasting chew toys you need for your aggressive chewer. This Nylabone power chew triple pack features a variety of flavors and textures so your dog will never get bored! This value pack of power chews keeps dogs busy, satisfies their natural urge to chew, and encourages positive chewing habits. Plus, the bristles raised during chewing promote clean teeth and help control plaque and tartar buildup.
feature_bullets: Long-lasting chew toys in delicious chicken, bacon, and peanut butter flavors challenge even the most aggressive chewers and discourage destructive chewing
Tough, durable nylon bones keep powerful chewers busy
Bristles raised during chewing these dog chew toys help clean teeth and control plaque and tartar
Chew toys made in the USA

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
